class_notes: Required of AMST and IDS majors spring semester of junior year, Interdisciplinary Research Design prepares students for writing their senior thesis. Over the course of the semester, students will (1) identify a research topic; (2) begin to collect scholarly sources for it; (3) learn how to maximize the library's offerings and to organize a bibliography using Zotero; (4) construct a research methodology; (5) make connections with possible faculty advisors; (6) gain presentation skills; (7) create a detailed outline; and (8) write a comprehensive thesis proposal that will be presented in a public forum, the annual ILA Symposium, to be held at the end of the semester. Approval for course enrollment granted by Dr. Peter Wakefield, IDS Director of Undergraduate Studies.
course_description:
Required of AMST and IDS majors spring semester of junior year, this course focuses intensively on the design and initiation of the senior research process. Students' projects are honed, refined, workshopped--bibliography, outline, budget, etc. Students are readied for
required senior year research.
